divs: sighting detailsat approxamately 8:30 12\25\07 indiana time. we live just west of indianapolis area. my husband called me outside of our home to "check out" something he saw in the sky. we are smokers (only outside as we have children) and star gaze and enjoy looking at the moon while outside smoking. i am not an astronomist and really know nothing about the stars and such so please excuse my generic explanation. my husband first noticed this star that appeared to be moving. he pointed up for me to look. something was positioned in the sky east of us slightly to the south of the position of the moon. it was slightly "orangish red" tinted and at times looked as though it had a white light or like a haze around it. it shined and tinkled some as though it were a star. at first i was certain it was just a satelite mistaken for a star or planet. yet, this was different and would move in all different directions. like, say...to the left slowly.... then right and a quick circle back to what seemed to be it's original position. it also seemed to be closer or further to\from us at times. please note we have not being drinking and are do not partake in any drugs. but while it was moving i would feel a little dizzy just looking at it. like i was moving. (if that makes sense) i began to figure it was maybe a planet or like, what ever yanno? tried to remain scientific about it. i kept my head about things and stayed calm. i mean i was certain i would never see something like a ship or whatever in my lifetime. as i figure these sightings are rare?? right? i didn't want to really think it was anything but a planet or whatever. so i called a friend who follows star and planets and things from an astrological nature. i thought maybe some strange mercury retrograde thing making me think this planet was a moving backwards. she would clear this up and i could laugh at him over the next 20 years saying "hey honey remember when you thought jupiter was a ufo" type thing, right? well...she too saw it! and agreed it was moving. her boyfriend (a total skeptic also agreed this "thing" appeared to move) we called several other people (mom's, sister's, nephew's, friends) all agreed it wasn't a "explanable thing". and that it was moving in an interesting manner. it is still there in the sky at the moment i write this. as i wanted to get online someplace and see if there were sightings. so i cannot say when it left. i'm still wondering if there is some other explanation. i would like to see if there are other "sightings" of this and if we're just looking at something else. i did want to note (at 11:07) husband came in to report he thinks he saw a shooting star. thought this might be interesting to note.
Object Flight Path: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
